claim: Flublok is produced using a novel production platform in which recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS).

extracted_evidence.quote: The recombinant quadrivalent influenza vaccine (RIV4, Flublok®, Supemtek® [EU, Canada], Sanofi pasteur) was the first licensed influenza vaccine to be produced using recombinant viral proteins instead of antigens derived from live influenza virus (as for inactivated split virion and subunit vaccines). RIV4 is an unadjuvanted vaccine containing 45 µg of HA/dose from each of the four strains. The production of RIV4 is based on a novel production platform in which recombinant HA (rHA) is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS)22. In brief, expresSF+ insect cells are infected with recombinant baculovirus carrying the relevant influenza HA genes, which are expressed under the control of a baculovirus polyhedrin promoter.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote directly states that Flublok (RIV4) is produced using a novel platform where recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system, matching the claim exactly.

extracted_evidence.quote: This review focuses on the structural features of BEVS derived rHA that make RIV4 unique from conventional vaccines, and how these features help to maximise vaccine performance.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote confirms that RIV4 (Flublok) uses rHA derived from BEVS (baculovirus expression vector system), supporting the claim about the production platform.

extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote, including the figure caption, describes the process of generating recombinant HA using the baculovirus insect cell expression system for RIV4, directly supporting the claim.

extracted_evidence.quote: Fig. 2 Structural features of native HA expressed on influenza virus and rHA produced in insect cells using the baculovirus expression vector system. a HA protein (shown as monomer) extracted from influenza virus is a heterodimer comprising HA1 (turquoise) and HA2 (orange) linked though an inter disulfide (S-S) bond and contains complex type sialylated N-linked glycans. Cleaved fusion peptides (green) and complex glycans eliminate and mask unique epitopes on HA respectively. b Recombinant HA protein (shown as monomer) expressed in insect cells.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote describes the production of recombinant HA in insect cells using the baculovirus expression vector system, specifically for Flublok, supporting the claim.
